item.title: India vs Australia 4th Test Day 4 Live Score: IND hunt more wickets after record-breaker Bumrah's burst, AUS resist - Hindustan Times
item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 4 Live Score

Date: December 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The fourth Test between India and Australia has seen a dramatic session with Marnus Labuschagne and Pat Cummins extending Australia's lead to 240 runs at Tea after a fiery spell from Jasprit Bumrah, who took key wickets to damage Australia’s middle order.

  • Labuschagne and Cummins have established a significant partnership.
  • Bumrah picked up crucial wickets including Travis Head and Mitchell Marsh.
  • India's bowling attack applied pressure early, reducing Australia to 53/2 at Lunch.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy scored 114, crucial in India's fightback.
  • Australia went into Tea at 135/6, needing to consolidate their innings while setting a challenging target.
“Jasprit Bumrah has torn into Australia's middle order and the hosts are all of a sudden down to their last four wickets with their lead less than 200.”

This match remains closely contested, with both teams having the potential for a victory as they head into the final stages of the Test.

item.title: Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Could Launch On January 22: Expected Price In India, Design, Camera, Specs, All You Need To Know - Times Now
item.description:
Samsung Galaxy S25 Ultra Could Launch On January 22: Expected Price In India, Design, Camera, Specs

Publication Date: TBD Source: TBD

Samsung is gearing up to launch the next flagship Galaxy S25 series, expected to debut on January 22, 2025, which could include the Galaxy S25, S25+, S25 Ultra, and the Galaxy S25 Slim.

  • The Galaxy S25 Ultra features a design overhaul with rounded corners and a vertical quad-camera arrangement.
  • It is expected to come in various colors including titanium black, titanium jade green, and titanium silver blue.
  • The phone may sport a Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset, 6.86-inch AMOLED display with 120Hz refresh rate, and a 200MP quad-camera setup.
  • Expected battery capacity of 5,000mAh with 45W fast charging.
  • Pricing for the S25 Ultra in India may start from above Rs 1,40,000, significantly higher than its predecessor.
“With the Galaxy S24 Ultra priced from Rs 1,29,999, the S25 Ultra may cross the Rs 1,40,000 mark.”

The upcoming launch of the Galaxy S25 Ultra represents Samsung's commitment to advancing smartphone technology with higher specifications and premium design.

item.title: ₹1,500 crore in 24 days, and now an OTT Twist: Is Allu Arjun's Pushpa 2 adding new scenes? - Business Today
item.description:
Pushpa 2 Breaks Box Office Records and Sparks Speculation About New Scenes

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The film 'Pushpa 2' has achieved significant box office success, amassing over ₹1,500 crore in just 24 days. Rumors arise regarding additional footage possibly being added.

  • 'Pushpa 2' has collected ₹1,500 crore globally, including ₹750 crore from its Hindi version.
  • Stars Allu Arjun, Rashmika Mandanna, and Fahadh Faasil.
  • Speculations suggest 15–20 minutes of additional footage may be added post-Christmas.
  • Current total domestic collection stands at ₹1,346 crore.
  • Varun Dhawan's 'Baby John' is not performing as well, with only ₹22.77 crore over its first four days.
“The total domestic collection stands at ₹1,346 crore, firmly cementing Pushpa 2’s status as a global juggernaut.”

The immense popularity of 'Pushpa 2' continues to dominate discussions, with anticipation building around possible new scenes enhancing this cinematic experience.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah Creates History, Becomes 1st Bowler In The World To... - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah Creates History as First Bowler to Achieve 200 Wickets with Average Below 20

Last Updated: December 29, 2024, 14:30 IST, Source: News18

‘National asset’ Jasprit Bumrah has made history by becoming the first bowler in Test cricket to take over 200 wickets with an average below 20. As of now, he has 202 wickets at an average of 19.38.

  • Bumrah completed his 200th wicket by dismissing Travis Head.
  • He surpassed Kapil Dev's record for the fastest Indian pacer to 200 wickets.
  • Bumrah leads the 2023-25 World Test Championship with 74 wickets in just 14 matches.
“Bumrah has achieved this feat in only 44 matches, compared to Kapil Dev's 50 matches.”

This milestone solidifies Bumrah's standing as a premier fast bowler in cricket history, highlighting his incredible talent and skill.

item.title: Plane with 181 on board crashes in South Korea, 47 dead - The Times of India
item.description:
Over 60 killed after plane with 181 on board crashes in South Korea

Date: October 2023
Source: Major News Outlet

This tragic incident involves a plane crash in South Korea that resulted in over 60 fatalities, raising concerns about aviation safety and emergency response protocols.

  • The aircraft had 181 individuals on board.
  • Rescue operations are ongoing, with emergency crews deployed to the crash site.
  • Preliminary investigations are looking into the causes of the crash.
  • This incident marks one of the deadliest aviation disasters in South Korea's recent history.
“Our thoughts are with the families affected by this tragedy.” - Local Official

The crash highlights the urgent need for thorough investigations into air travel safety measures as the affected communities grapple with the loss of life.

item.description:
India vs Australia 4th Test Day 4 Live Updates: Jasprit Bumrah Tears Into Australia, Reaches Huge Milestone

item.title: Indian-origin CEO of billion-dollar company reveals about his ‘great conversation’ with PM Modi - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Indian-origin CEO of billion-dollar company reveals about his ‘great conversation’ with PM Modi

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Aravind Srinivas, the Indian-origin CEO of Perplexity AI, recently met with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and shared insights about their conversation, particularly regarding the potential for AI adoption in India and globally.

  • Aravind Srinivas expressed his admiration for PM Modi’s vision and dedication towards AI.
  • The meeting highlighted the importance of advancing AI technology in India.
  • Social media users celebrated the meeting with congratulatory messages to Srinivas.
  • Srinivas co-founded Perplexity AI after working at OpenAI, DeepMind, and Google.
  • He holds degrees from IIT Madras and a PhD from UC Berkeley.
“Modi Ji’s dedication to staying updated on the topic and his remarkable vision for the future.” - Aravind Srinivas

This meeting marks a significant moment for Indian tech, emphasizing the collaboration between leaders in technology and government.

item.title: Australia: Man killed by shark while fishing with family - The Times of India
item.description:
Man Killed by Shark While Fishing with Family in Australia

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Local News

A tragic incident occurred in Australia where a man was killed by a shark while fishing with his family. This event highlights the dangers that can arise in shark-prone waters, even during recreational activities.

  • The victim was reportedly fishing near a popular beach.
  • Emergency services were called to the scene, but the man could not be saved.
  • The incident has raised concerns about shark safety in the area.
"This is a tragic reminder of the risks involved when in shark-infested waters." – Local Safety Official

The community has been left in shock following this incident, and discussions are underway regarding public safety measures in coastal areas.

item.title: Salman Khan cuts four-tier cake with niece Ayat at Jamnagar birthday bash; Mukesh Ambani-Nita Ambani sing for him. Watch - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Salman Khan Celebrated His Special Day with His Close Ones

Date: Dec 29, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Actor Salman Khan celebrated his 59th birthday with family and close friends in Jamnagar, Gujarat, at a lavish party hosted by Mukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani. The event featured a four-tier cake, singing, and festive fireworks.

  • Salman cut a large cake, assisted by his niece Ayat.
  • Family members and guests included his mother, stepmother, siblings, and notable Bollywood figures.
  • Mukesh and Nita Ambani sang for Salman during the cake-cutting ceremony.
  • Social media was abuzz with birthday wishes for Salman from other celebrities.
  • Salman is set to star in the upcoming film Sikandar, scheduled for Eid 2025 release.
“Best birthday wishes from Singham to Chulbul” - Ajay Devgn

The birthday celebration was a grand affair that showcased the warmth of family and the glamour of Bollywood, marking another year in Salman Khan's illustrious career.

item.title: India's Koneru Humpy becomes Rapid chess world champion for the second time - The Times of India
item.description:
India's Koneru Humpy becomes Rapid chess world champion for the second time

Publication Date: [Insert Publication Date] Source: [Insert Source]

An incredible achievement as Koneru Humpy wins the Rapid Chess World Championship for the second time, showcasing her exceptional skill and determination in the game.

  • Koneru Humpy, an Indian chess player, claims her second Rapid Chess World Championship title.
  • The championship showcased elite players from around the globe.
  • This win reinforces Humpy's status as one of the top players in women's chess.
  • The event emphasizes the growing popularity and support for chess in India.
“Winning this title again is a dream come true,” said Humpy during the award ceremony.

This victory not only adds to her accolades but also inspires many aspiring chess players, particularly women in the sport.

item.title: South Korean plane crash with 181 passengers catches fire at Muan airport; media report 28 people dead - The Hindu
item.description:
South Korean plane crash with 181 passengers catches fire at Muan airport; media report 28 people dead

Published: December 29, 2024 07:20 am IST | Source: Reuters

A plane burst into flames after veering off a runway at Muan International Airport, resulting in at least 28 deaths among the 181 passengers on board. The aircraft skidded off the runway just after landing due to a suspected malfunction of its landing gear.

  • The aircraft caught fire when it collided with a fence after landing.
  • Emergency services deployed 32 fire trucks and helicopters to manage the situation.
  • Two individuals, one passenger and one crew member, were rescued.
  • Local authorities are investigating the cause of the accident.
“The fire engulfed the aircraft carrying 181 people when it skidded off the runway just after landing.”

This tragic incident highlights the importance of addressing aviation safety and emergency response protocols to prevent such disasters in the future.

Source: NDTV

“Siraj has been sensational today, taking important wickets that could change the course of the match.”

This match highlights the intense competition between India and Australia, showcasing players' skills and the excitement of Test cricket.

item.title: It’s a great program: Trump appears to side with Musk in H-1B visa row - The Hindu
item.description:
Trump Supports H-1B Visas Amid Controversy with Musk and Tech Industry

Publication Date: December 29, 2024 | Source: New York Post

In a recent interview, President-elect Donald Trump expressed support for H-1B visas, siding with Elon Musk and tech enthusiasts, amidst ongoing disputes about their impact on American jobs.

  • Trump praised H-1B visas as essential for attracting skilled foreign workers.
  • He acknowledged a past of criticizing the program, citing it as 'very bad' for U.S. workers.
  • His previous administration focused on limiting visa usage to prioritize high-skilled applicants.
  • Despite criticisms, Trump indicated his businesses have utilized H-1B visas.
  • The debate over H-1B visas has caused a rift among his conservative base, particularly online.
“I have always liked the visas, I have always been in favor of the visas. That’s why we have them.” – Donald Trump

In conclusion, Trump's recent statements signal a shift in his stance towards H-1B visas, conflicting with the hardline immigration policies that formed a key part of his campaign.

item.title: FIDE 2024: Koneru Humpy grabs second Women’s World Rapid Chess Championship title in New York - The Hindu
item.description:
Koneru Humpy wins second Women's World Rapid Chess Championship in New York

Published: December 29, 2024 | Source: The Hindu

India’s Koneru Humpy bagged an epochal second World Rapid Chess Championship title, beating Irene Sukandar of Indonesia in New York on Sunday (December 29, 2024).

  • Humpy previously won the championship in 2019 at Georgia.
  • She is only the second player to win the title more than once after China’s Ju Wenjun.
  • Humpy finished the tournament with 8.5 out of 11 points.
  • The men’s title was won by 18-year-old Volodar Murzin from Russia.
  • This achievement follows a successful year for Indian chess.
“Humpy has always excelled in the Rapid worlds as she had won a bronze medal in the 2012 edition of the event held in Moscow.”

Humpy's victory marks another milestone in her illustrious career and reflects the strength of Indian chess on the global stage.

item.description:
Biden reportedly regrets dropping out of US presidential race. Could he have beaten Trump?

Publication Date: Not specified

Source: Not specified

Biden's withdrawal from the presidential race has raised questions about his potential rivalship against Trump.

  • Biden's decision to drop out may have affected his chances against Trump.
  • The article explores whether Biden could have won the election if he had participated.

“Could Biden have turned the tide in favor of Democrats?”

This article analyzes the implications of Biden's departure and his reflection on what might have been.

item.title: Watch: Jasprit Bumrah's Epic Send-Off To Sam Konstas After Shattering His Middle Stump - NDTV Sports
item.description:
Watch: Jasprit Bumrah's Epic Send-Off To Sam Konstas After Shattering His Middle Stump

Publication Date: December 29, 2024

Source: NDTV Sports

Jasprit Bumrah faced off against Sam Konstas in a thrilling match on Day 4 of the fourth Test in Melbourne, showcasing Bumrah's exceptional bowling skills.

  • Bumrah dismissed Konstas with a stunning inswinger that hit the middle stump.
  • Bumrah celebrated emphatically, mocking Konstas's previous crowd engagement.
  • Konstas began his innings strongly before being bowled out, contributing 18 runs.
  • Nitish Kumar Reddy scored 114 runs for India in their first innings.
MIDDLE STUMP! Jasprit Bumrah gets Sam Konstas with a pearler. — cricket.com.au (@cricketcomau) December 29, 2024

The match highlighted Bumrah's cricketing prowess and the competitive spirit of the ongoing Test series.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah mocks Sam Konstas after avenging debutant in rare celebration; gets booed by MCG crowd - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah mocks Sam Konstas after avenging debutant in rare celebration; gets booed by MCG crowd

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The fourth Test match of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy saw an interesting exchange between young Australian batsman Sam Konstas and India’s Jasprit Bumrah, where Bumrah avenged a previous mockery by taking an early wicket of Konstas.

  • Sam Konstas dominated Bumrah on Day 1 with a series of aggressive shots including a ramp six.
  • Bumrah retaliated by dismissing Konstas early in Australia’s second innings.
  • After taking the wicket, Bumrah celebrated in a rare manner, imitating Konstas' earlier celebration, which drew boos from the Melbourne crowd.
  • India was bowled out for 369, with Nitish Kumar Reddy scoring his maiden Test century.
Bumrah's response to Konstas' earlier display was a spectacle, earning mixed reactions from the crowd.

This encounter showcased competitive spirit and skill in cricket, as Bumrah’s decisive move turned the tide after Konstas's initial triumph.

item.title: Israel finds massive Hezbollah weapon cache at ‘military base disguised as village’ in Lebanon - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Israel Discovers Large Hezbollah Weapons Cache Disguised as Civilian Infrastructure

Date: Dec 29, 2024 Source: HT News

The Israeli Defence Forces (IDF) have uncovered a significant cache of weapons hidden within civilian infrastructure in southern Lebanon, highlighting concerns about Hezbollah's military operations within civilian areas.

  • Findings included a truck mounted with 40 rocket launcher barrels near Naqoura.
  • Additional weapons were discovered inside a pharmacy, including explosives and RPG missiles.
  • Hezbollah is reportedly preparing for further conflict and has resumed reconstruction efforts.
  • The IDF conducted an airstrike targeting Hezbollah's weapons smuggling unit.
  • Growing tensions between the IDF and UNIFIL regarding ceasefire agreements.
“Those aren't villages with some military infrastructure, this is a military base disguised as a civilian area.” - Sarit Zahavi, president of the Alma Research Center

The IDF's discovery underscores ongoing instability in the region, with potential long-term implications for both Israel and Lebanon.

item.title: These are the 7 biggest milestones in the aerospace industry so far this millennium: Review 24 years of rockets with us - Softonic EN
item.description:
These are the 7 biggest milestones in the aerospace industry so far this millennium: Review 24 years of rockets with us

Publication Date: N/A Source: Softonic

This article reviews significant milestones in the aerospace industry from 2000 to 2024, highlighting advancements and achievements that have shaped modern space exploration.

  • Artemis I: NASA's mission to send humans back to the Moon.
  • The Dragon capsule: SpaceX's successful crewed missions to the ISS.
  • Detection of gravitational waves, confirming key principles of physics.
  • Emergence of space tourism marked by private missions.
  • China's Chang’e program, entering the global space race.
  • Successful recovery of SpaceX's Starship rocket.
  • Launch of the Falcon Heavy, demonstrating commercial aerospace viability.
“This technical achievement demonstrates several important things, including the verification of the radical approach to catching a rocket.”

The aerospace industry continues to evolve rapidly, with innovations reshaping the future of space exploration.

Date: Dec 29, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

The Aquarius horoscope for the week predicts a time of golden opportunities coupled with attention needed in love life and health management.

  • Utilize every opportunity to prove professional capabilities.
  • Financial stats are promising, though they may fluctuate.
  • Health minor issues like stomach aches and viral fevers are possible.

item.title: 'Calm down': Ravi Shastri on Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal at MCG - The Times of India
item.description:
Calm down: Ravi Shastri on Rishabh Pant's bizarre dismissal at MCG

Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

In a crucial phase of Day 3 at the MCG, Rishabh Pant's risky shot selection led to his dismissal, sparking debate among fans and experts about his aggressive playing style.

  • Pant attempted a scoop shot against Scott Boland but was caught out, leaving India at 191/5.
  • Criticism of Pant's shot selection included comments from cricketer Sunil Gavaskar, who labeled it “stupid.”
  • Ravi Shastri defended Pant, suggesting that it’s important to assess the context of his dismissals across innings.
  • Shastri emphasized the need for Pant to adapt his approach during matches and play with maturity.
“It's not in every innings he has attempted that shot... Let’s calm down here, guys. It’s not every time he’s throwing it away.” - Ravi Shastri

Shastri also remarked on Pant's propensity for high-risk shots, noting that while they can be effective, they must be executed wisely in changing game situations.

item.title: Unimech Aerospace IPO Listing On Tuesday: GMP At 91.08% Indicates Robust Gains For Investors - News18
item.description:
Unimech Aerospace IPO Listing On Tuesday: GMP At 91.08% Indicates Robust Gains For Investors

Date: December 28, 2024
Source: News18

The Unimech Aerospace IPO is set to list on December 31, showing a 91.08% premium over its issue price of Rs 785, indicating significant investor interest.

  • The IPO received a remarkable 184.34 times subscription.
  • Unimech Aerospace shares are currently trading at Rs 1,500 in the grey market.
  • The listing will take place on both BSE and NSE.
  • The price band of the IPO was between Rs 745 and 785.
“Grey market premium indicates investors’ readiness to pay more than the issue price.”

This IPO is significant for its robust subscription figures and the expectation of solid gains for investors on its upcoming listing.

item.title: 7 amazing cosmology pictures by NASA Hubble Space Telescope - India.com
item.description:
7 Amazing Cosmology Pictures by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Publication Date: [Insert Date] Source: India.com

This article features stunning images captured by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, showcasing the wonders of the universe through cosmology.

  • Lensing cluster Abell 383: A giant galaxy cluster showing the effect of dark matter bending light.
  • Hubble’s colourful view of the Universe: A detailed and colorful portrait of the evolving Universe.
  • Dark matter ring discovery: An international team found a ghostly ring formed by colliding galaxy clusters.
  • Cosmic Snake: A galaxy with regions of intense star formation affected by gravitational lensing.
  • Rings of Relativity: A unique cosmic phenomenon featuring a galaxy elegantly curving around another.
  • Astronomy in Action: A rare celestial phenomenon showcased in a striking Hubble image.
  • Ghost light from dead galaxies: Pandoras Cluster captured in a ghostly Hubble view.
Astronomers have utilized Hubble’s capability to capture detailed and colorful images of phenomena that would otherwise remain unseen.

This collection of images serves as a reminder of the incredible capabilities of the Hubble Space Telescope and its contributions to our understanding of the cosmos.

item.title: 5 mentally stimulating jobs that can prevent Alzheimer's, dementia - The Times of India
item.description:
5 Mentally Stimulating Jobs That Can Prevent Alzheimer's and Dementia

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

A recent study highlights the importance of mentally stimulating jobs in reducing the risk of cognitive decline and dementia as we age.

  • Individuals in least mentally demanding jobs face a higher risk of cognitive decline.
  • Professions such as teaching, medicine, scientific research, management, and law are crucial in maintaining mental sharpness.
  • Those in less demanding roles have a 66% greater risk of mild cognitive impairment and a 31% greater risk of dementia post-70.
“Mentally stimulating jobs through life are linked to a decreased incidence of dementia and Alzheimer's disease.”

In conclusion, choosing a mentally stimulating job can significantly contribute to maintaining cognitive health and preventing serious conditions like Alzheimer's and dementia.

item.title: Donald Trump breaks silence on H-1B row, supports Elon-Vivek: 'It's a great program' - The Times of India
item.description:
Donald Trump breaks silence on H-1B row, supports Elon-Vivek: 'It's a great program'

Publication Date: 2023-10-20 Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, Donald Trump expressed his support for the H-1B visa program, siding with notable figures such as Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy amidst ongoing debates regarding the program's impact on the job market.

  • Trump declares H-1B as a 'great program' beneficial for innovation and technology sectors.
  • The statement aims to quell concerns over the program's influence on American jobs.
  • Musk and Ramaswamy have also been vocal supporters of revising the program to attract global talent.
"It's a great program that helps bring in the best and brightest minds to America." - Donald Trump

This support could shift the narrative around H-1B visas, potentially influencing future immigration policies.
